articles.title: CBOT soybeans ease on improving South American weather
articles.description: CHICAGO, March 11 (Reuters) - Chicago Board of Trade soybean futures fell on Friday, pressured by rains in Brazil and Argentina that may have stabilized conditions as crops near harvest following a drought-stricken growing season. * The benchmark CBOT May soybean futures contract settled down 10-1/4 cents at $16.76 a bushel. * The contract briefly dipped below the 10-day

articles.title: Argentina lawmakers approve IMF deal to repay vast debt
articles.description: Buenos Aires, Argentina—Lawmakers in Argentina on Friday approved a deal with the International Monetary Fund to restructure a ruinous $45-billion debt ahead of a vote in the upper house.
articles.content:
Buenos Aires, Argentina—Lawmakers in Argentina on Friday approved a deal with the International Monetary Fund to restructure a ruinous $45-billion debt ahead of a vote in the upper house.
A demonstrator hurls stones to the Congress during a protest a... [2894 chars]

articles.title: Argentina lower house approves IMF deal, pushing it to Senate
articles.description: Read more about Argentina lower house approves IMF deal, pushing it to Senate on Devdiscourse
articles.content:
Argentina's lower Chamber of Deputies approved in the early hours of Friday an agreement with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to restructure $45 billion in debt, which should now move up to the Senate in the coming days for a final vote.

articles.title: Bizarrap & Residente Debut Atop Billboard Argentina Hot 100
articles.description: Residente scores his first No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 as “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 49" debuts at No. 1 on the March 5-dated survey.
articles.content: Residente scores his first No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 as “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 49,” his first collaboration with Argentinian producer Bizarrap, debuts at No. 1 on the March 5-dated survey, two days after the rap song was released v... [1659 chars]

articles.title: Argentina's sunflower crop could dip just as Ukraine war hits supply
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, March 10 (Reuters) - Argentina's sunflower crop could fall below a recent forecast on lower yields and excess rainfall, the capital's grains exchange said on Thursday, just when international buyers scramble to secure supplies as the war in Ukraine disrupts the global grains trade.The last sunflower crop forecast from the Buenos Aires Grains

articles.title: Argentina north-central farming zones set for heavy rains, less in core - exchange
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, March 10 (Reuters) - Argentina's north and large parts of the central farming region are set for heavy rains and storms over the next few days, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday, as farmers prepare to start harvesting key corn and soy crops in earnest.The exchange said in a weather report, however, that the "core" farm belt region would get

articles.title: Argentine grains exchange trims corn, soy harvest forecasts
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, March 9 (Reuters) - Argentina's Rosario grains exchange cut its forecasts for 2021/22 soy and corn production on Thursday due to the impact of drought that has hit crops since the start of the year, despite recent rains that have helped limit further losses.The exchange trimmed its soybean production estimate to 40 million tonnes from 40.5

articles.title: CERAWEEK-Argentina committed to reducing energy subsidies over time -economy minister
articles.description: Argentina is committed to reducing energy subsidies - one of the main elements of an international debt renegotiation - even amid higher import prices, but the cuts will come gradually, its economy minister said on Wednesday.
